Posted By: Eliteninjasauce (10/28/2011 12:24:06 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@Superllama12  
[Fling](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fling) would do 10 damage if you flung a [Death's Shadow](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Death's Shadow) when you were at 3 life, because [Fling](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fling) checks the creature's power based on the creature's last known existence on the battlefield.
posts.html:
@Superllama12
Fling would do 10 damage if you flung a Death's Shadow when you were at 3 life, because Fling checks the creature's power based on the creature's last known existence on the battlefield.

Posted By: Superllama12 (10/30/2011 4:37:50 PM)
Rating:

@Eliteninjasauce: Thanks for the response.

But now I wonder how it would play out if you Fling in response to a Soul's Fire or a Boros Fury-Shield being played on your creature. I recall reading the rules that for a spell to play out completely it must have a valid target upon casting AND when it resolves. But I hear people talking about "last known power on the battlefield" as well.

If I attack with a creature and my opponent uses Boros Fury-Shield on it and I respond with Fling before the fury-shield resolves, do I take damage from the fury-shield?
